title: Welcome & Grounding
description: Warm greeting and present-moment grounding to start the session
instructions: Open warmly, ask about their day, and help them settle into the session.
script: Hello! I'm so glad to spend some time with you today. How are you feeling right now?
That's lovely to hear. Let's take a nice deep breath together before we begin.
Wonderful. I have some fun activities planned for us today.
goal: Create emotional safety and orient to the present moment.

title: Daily Anchor
description: Use a personal anchor to orient to time and place
instructions: Invite the user to describe something familiar from their day.
script: Good to see you! What's something you noticed today - maybe the weather, or something in your home?
I can picture that. What time of day is it for you right now?
Perfect. Let's get started with our activities.
goal: Blend sensory grounding with time orientation.

title: Word Garden - Planting
description: Present a word list for immediate recall, with delayed recall later
instructions: Read the words clearly with pauses. After presenting all words, ask for immediate recall. Keep track of which words they remember for the harvest activity later.
script: Let's play a memory game! I'm going to plant some words in your memory garden. Listen carefully, and then tell me as many as you can remember.
Here are your words: Apple... Bicycle... Sunset... Garden... Music... Elephant... Kitchen... Rainbow
Now, tell me as many of those words as you can remember. Don't worry about the order.
Wonderful! Let's see how many are still blooming later. We'll check back in a few minutes.
goal: Encode words for immediate and delayed recall assessment.

title: Animal Spotter
description: Say 'yes' quickly when you hear an animal name
instructions: Present words one at a time with about 2 seconds between them. User should say 'yes' for animals and stay silent for non-animals. Track accuracy and response time.
script: Let's play Animal Spotter! I'll say different words. When you hear an animal, say 'yes' as quickly as you can. If it's not an animal, just stay quiet. Ready?
Here we go: Table... Dog... Window... Cat... Mountain... Horse... Lamp... Fish... Book... Bird... Chair... Rabbit
Great job! You spotted most of the animals.
goal: Exercise sustained attention and quick response inhibition.

title: Number Hunter
description: Count how many times you hear the target number
instructions: Read a sequence of numbers. User counts how many times the target number (7) appears. Check their count at the end.
script: Let's hunt for numbers! I'll say a sequence of numbers. Count how many times you hear the number 7. Keep track in your head.
How many 7s did you hear?
Let me check... there were four 7s. Great counting!
goal: Exercise sustained attention and counting.

title: Sound Focus
description: Alternate between real and imagined sounds
instructions: Guide the user to focus on real sounds around them, then imagined sounds from memory. Help them make the shift smoothly.
script: Let's tune into sounds. First, pause and tell me the softest sound you can hear right now.
Now close your eyes and imagine a sound from a favorite place. What do you hear in your mind?
One more: a real sound, and one imagined. How do they each make you feel?
goal: Practice shifting attention while engaging pleasant imagery.

title: Listen and Tap
description: Tap the table when you hear a color word
instructions: Present words one at a time. User taps the table for color words. Can't see the tap but ask them to say 'tap' when they do it.
script: Here's a fun one! I'll say words, and when you hear a color, tap the table and say 'tap'. Ready?
Here we go: House... Blue... Tree... Red... Book... Green... Music... Yellow... Window... Orange
Excellent! You caught those colors nicely.
goal: Practice attention and response to specific categories.

title: Quick Connections
description: Say the first word that comes to mind as fast as possible
instructions: Give a word and wait for immediate association. Capture response time. Give encouragement between words.
script: Let's make quick connections! When I say a word, say the very first thing that pops into your mind. Don't think too hard - just go with your gut!
Ocean
Now try: Kitchen
Good! How about: Happy
Quick one: Music
Almost done: Garden
Last one: Family
Wonderful! Your mind made some great connections.
goal: Measure and exercise processing speed through word associations.

title: Category Snap
description: Quickly categorize items as food or not food
instructions: Present items rapidly. User says 'yes' for food, 'no' otherwise. Track both accuracy and speed.
script: Category Snap! I'll name things, and you say 'yes' if it's food, 'no' if it's not. Go as fast as you can!
Ready? Apple
Chair
Pizza
Lamp
Banana
Book
Sandwich
Window
Soup
Table
Fast thinking! You did great!
goal: Exercise rapid categorization and decision-making.

title: Rapid Fire Questions
description: Quick simple questions to measure retrieval speed
instructions: Ask simple questions with obvious answers. Measure how quickly they respond.
script: Quick questions - answer as fast as you can! What color is grass?
What's 2 plus 2?
What do you drink in the morning?
How many days in a week?
What color is the sky?
What's your first name?
How many legs does a dog have?
What month comes after January?
Lightning fast! Great job!
goal: Measure basic retrieval speed with overlearned information.

title: Number Echo
description: Repeat number sequences in the same order
instructions: Start with 3 digits. If correct, add one more digit. If wrong twice at the same length, stop. Record the maximum span achieved.
script: Let's play Number Echo! I'll say some numbers, and you repeat them back in the same order. We'll start easy and see how far we can go!
Ready? Here's your first set: 4... 7... 2
Perfect! Let's try a longer one.
Great effort! You remembered sequences of [X] numbers.
goal: Measure and exercise forward digit span.

title: Backwards Challenge
description: Repeat number sequences in reverse order
instructions: Start with 2 digits. User repeats them backwards. Increase on success, stop after 2 failures at same length.
script: Now for a twist - the Backwards Challenge! I'll say numbers, and you say them in reverse order. So if I say 3-5, you say 5-3. Let's try!
Here we go: 8... 3
Excellent! Let's try more.
Wonderful work! You reversed sequences of [X] numbers.
goal: Measure and exercise backward digit span.

title: Word Match Game
description: Say 'match' when you hear the same word as 2 words ago
instructions: Read words one at a time. User says 'match' when the word is the same as 2 words back. Track hits, misses, and false alarms.
script: Word Match Game! I'll say words one at a time. Say 'match' when you hear the same word as TWO words ago. So if I say cat-dog-cat, you'd say 'match' on the second cat.
Let's practice: Dog... Tree... Dog
Now the real game: Apple... House... Apple... Bird... Tree... Bird... Cat... Apple... Cat... Sun... Moon... Sun
Great focus! That's a tricky one.
goal: Exercise working memory through n-back matching.

title: Sentence Collector
description: Remember the last word of each sentence
instructions: Read 3 sentences. User remembers the last word of each. Then ask them to recall all the last words.
script: Sentence Collector! I'll say a few sentences. Remember the LAST word of each one. At the end, tell me all the last words.
First: The children played in the sunny park.
Second: She baked a delicious chocolate cake.
Third: The old man fed the hungry birds.
Now, what were those three last words?
Great memory! The words were: park, cake, and birds.
goal: Exercise working memory by tracking final words.

title: Word Garden - Harvest
description: Delayed recall of the word list from earlier
instructions: Ask user to recall the words from the Word Garden activity earlier. Don't give hints unless they're really stuck. Note which words they remember.
script: Remember those words we planted in your memory garden earlier? Let's see which ones are still blooming! Tell me as many as you can remember.
Take your time, any order is fine.
Wonderful! Your memory garden grew [X] words.
goal: Assess delayed recall of previously encoded words.

title: Story Journey
description: Listen to a short story and recall key details
instructions: Read the story clearly. Then ask specific questions about details. Score based on correct details recalled.
script: Let me tell you a short story. Listen carefully, and I'll ask you some questions afterward.
On Tuesday morning, a man named Peter walked to the bakery on Maple Street. He bought three croissants and a cup of coffee. On his way home, he stopped to pet a friendly golden retriever named Max.
Now, let me ask you: What day was it?
What was the man's name?
What street was the bakery on?
How many croissants did he buy?
What was the dog's name?
Great listening! You remembered those details well.
goal: Exercise narrative memory and detail recall.

title: Recipe Memory
description: Recall a meaningful recipe step by step
instructions: Guide the user through recalling a favorite recipe. Ask about senses, people, and sequence.
script: Let's walk through a favorite recipe in your mind. What dish are we making together?
Who taught you this recipe, or who do you think of when you make it?
Walk me through the steps - what happens first, and what smells start to fill the kitchen?
What's the best part of making this dish?
goal: Reinforce autobiographical memory through structured recall.

title: Letter Dash
description: Name as many words as possible starting with a letter
instructions: Give them 45 seconds. Count valid words (no proper nouns, no repetitions). Encourage them throughout.
script: Letter Dash! Name as many words as you can that start with the letter F. You have about 45 seconds. Ready? Go!
Keep going, you're doing great!
A few more seconds...
Time! Wonderful - you came up with [X] words!
goal: Exercise phonemic fluency and lexical retrieval.

title: Category Sprint
description: Name as many items in a category as possible
instructions: Give them 45 seconds to name animals. Count valid unique animals. Encourage throughout.
script: Category Sprint! Name as many animals as you can think of. You have about 45 seconds. Go!
Great ones! Keep them coming!
Almost there...
Time! You named [X] animals - that's fantastic!
goal: Exercise semantic fluency and category retrieval.

title: Word Explorer
description: Discuss the meaning of a word in context
instructions: Present a word and explore its meaning through conversation. Look for depth of understanding and personal connections.
script: Let's explore a word together: 'resilience'. What does that word mean to you?
Can you think of a time when you or someone you know showed resilience?
That's a beautiful example. Resilience really is about bouncing back.
goal: Exercise vocabulary depth and semantic understanding.

title: Story Weaver
description: Expand a personal topic into a rich narrative
instructions: Help the user build a story from a personal memory or topic. Ask about details, feelings, and people involved.
script: Let's weave a story together. Think of a favorite room, a treasured object, or a family tradition. What comes to mind first?
Paint me a picture - who else is there with you in this memory?
If I could step into that moment, what would I feel or notice first?
goal: Encourage expressive language rooted in personal meaning.

title: Category Switcher
description: Alternate between naming categories and items
instructions: Give an item, user names the category. Give a category, user names an item. Alternate and track accuracy.
script: Category Switcher! I'll name something, you tell me its category. Then I'll name a category, you give me an example. Back and forth!
Let's start: Apple - what category?
Good! Now give me an animal.
Great! Hammer - what category?
Now name a color.
Piano - what category?
Give me a type of weather.
Rose - what category?
Name a vehicle.
Excellent switching!
goal: Exercise cognitive flexibility through task alternation.

title: Countdown Challenge
description: Count backwards by a specific number
instructions: User counts backwards from 50 by 3s. Track errors and how far they get. Offer encouragement.
script: Countdown Challenge! Start at 50 and count backwards by 3. So 50, 47, 44... Keep going as far as you can!
You're doing great, keep going!
Excellent mental math! You made it to [X].
goal: Exercise working memory and arithmetic processing.

title: Follow the Path
description: Follow multi-step instructions in sequence
instructions: Give 3 instructions. User performs them in order. Check if all steps are completed correctly.
script: Follow the Path! I'll give you three things to do. Wait until I say 'go', then do them in order.
First, touch your nose. Second, clap twice. Third, say your favorite color.
Ready? Go!
Perfect sequence!
goal: Exercise instruction following and sequencing.

title: Rule Change Game
description: Follow a rule, then switch to the opposite
instructions: First round: say 'big' for big things, 'small' for small. Then switch the rule. Track accuracy before and after the switch.
script: Rule Change Game! First rule: say 'big' for big things, 'small' for small things.
Elephant
Ant
Mountain
Button
Ocean
Now here's the twist - SWITCH! Say 'small' for big things, and 'big' for small things!
House
Pea
Whale
Grain of sand
Tree
Seed
Tricky when the rules flip! Great mental flexibility.
goal: Exercise cognitive flexibility through rule reversal.

title: Mental Postcard
description: Plan and compose a short message
instructions: Guide user to plan and create a short message. Help with structure: greeting, content, closing.
script: Let's write a mental postcard! Imagine sending a note to someone you care about. Who would you write to?
What's the first thing you'd say to make them smile?
Add one memory or inside joke - something only they would understand.
How would you sign off?
goal: Exercise planning and structured communication.

title: Voice Feelings
description: Identify emotions from how sentences are spoken
instructions: Say sentences with different emotions. User identifies the emotion. Use clear emotional tones.
script: Voice Feelings! Listen to HOW I say these sentences and tell me what emotion you hear.
First one: 'I can't believe you did that!' - How do I sound?
Next: 'Oh... I see... that's fine, I guess.' - What emotion is that?
How about: 'This is the best day ever!' - What am I feeling?
Last one: 'I'm not sure what to do next.' - What emotion?
Great ear for emotions!
goal: Exercise emotion recognition from vocal cues.

title: Mind Reader Stories
description: Predict what characters think and believe
instructions: Tell short scenarios about false beliefs. User predicts where character will look or what they think. Classic theory of mind tasks.
script: Let's read some minds! I'll tell you a short story, and you tell me what the person is thinking.
Sarah put her book in the drawer before leaving the room. While she was gone, her brother Tom moved it to the shelf. When Sarah comes back, where will she look for her book first?
Why would she look there?
Good thinking! Here's another: Mary thinks the candy is in the blue box. But you and I know it's really in the red box. If I ask Mary where the candy is, what will she say?
Exactly! You're great at understanding how others think.
goal: Exercise theory of mind and perspective-taking.

title: Perspective Pal
description: Discuss emotions and reactions in social situations
instructions: Present social scenarios and explore emotional understanding. Look for empathy and insight.
script: Let's think about feelings together. Imagine your friend just got some disappointing news. What might they be feeling?
What could you say or do to help them feel better?
That's very thoughtful. How do you usually know when someone needs support?
goal: Exercise empathy and social understanding.

title: Social Detective
description: Discuss social relationships and support networks
instructions: Guide conversation about people who support them. Look for social awareness and gratitude.
script: Let's be social detectives! Think of someone who has supported you recently. Who comes to mind?
What did they do that made you feel supported?
If you could send them a quick thank-you right now, what would you say?
goal: Exercise social awareness and relationship reflection.

title: Warm Closing
description: Personalized session wrap-up
instructions: Reference specific things from the session. End with warmth and encouragement for the day ahead.
script: What a wonderful session! Before we wrap up, what was your favorite part of what we did today?
I really enjoyed hearing about [reference something specific from session].
You did great work today. Take care, and I'll see you next time!
goal: End with personalized warmth and positive reinforcement.

title: Affirmation Sendoff
description: End with a personalized affirmation
instructions: Create a brief affirmation based on something they shared. Guide a deep breath together.
script: Let's close with a moment of calm. Take a deep breath with me.
Based on what you shared today, here's a thought to carry with you: You are [personalized affirmation].
Take good care, and I'll see you soon!
goal: End with personalized affirmation and calm.
